relation: Great for these types of students

Students who were fond of high school life may find Glendale Community College similar to that. Classes are small and personal like in most high schools and that means the teachers are more available to help individuals on a need to need basis.
Glendale Community College offers a wide range of courses and classes that are financially feasible for most students that cannot pay for more expensive educational campuses.
GCC's cafeteria is good but has a few items that are a little bit pricey. The actual dining area is great where there is much social interaction between students, but it never gets too distracting.

Most classes at Glendale Community College are not too tough if you study. The key is studying. The more time you put into your homework assignments, the more likely you are to pass. Doing the little things like looking over notes or even doing a few extra problems on homework can go a long way on your test scores. In some cases, a class can become difficult for just you alone, but the free tutoring at Glendale Community College is very helpful in getting you passed your speed bumps.

Make sure you do not apply last minute. You will thank yourself when you are able to register for the classes you want and not be stuck in limbo on the waiting list to register for the class. Also take advantage of the free tutoring on campus. It may come in handy for more challenging courses.

Glendale Community College is a great start to post-high school education. Its helpful atmosphere eases new students in with no hassle. Best of all, it is transfer friendly with many other Universities across the valley.

The main campus at GCC North locations offers classes and programs throughout the West valley. There are supportive faculty members and helpful student services. They are ready to provide each student with the knowledge, skills and support they will need to succeed in the college and the world beyond it. For the past year, it has been a great opportunity for me to go to school there (ACE Plus program).I am going to be so prepared when I transfer to a university. textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Try your hardest on the placement test. It's nothing too difficult however if you do place in honors criteria, you will receive a full-ride presidential scholarship as I did. You will need to keep up with the requirements such as a 3.25 GPA and 12 credit hours which include one honors class. As long as you study, be attentive, and do your homework it will not be difficult to keep! Bang for the buck Glendale Community College is extremely affordable. They offer academic scholarships through high school placement, placement testing, and an honors program. Saving money is critically important, and going through community college either to achieve an associates degree or transfer to a university is the way to go! Glendale Community College is the school everyone should consider around the Maricopa County. Am enjoying being here The atmosphere overall is positive and pleasant. Professors are also fun and enjoyable through class. I found that it was very easy to be attentive in all of my classes and I never got bored. There are a lot of staff at the campuses that are more than willing to help new students with smiles. Am learning a lot The professors at
